name.text: 27.2.1.2 Functions as Limits of Integration Task

questiontext.text:
Evaluate the following double integral over a non-rectangular region.

\(\displaystyle \displaystyle\int_{x=0}^{@aa@}\displaystyle\int_{y=x}^{@aa@}\left(x^2+y^2\right)\; \mathrm{d}y \, \mathrm{d}x\)

It would be helpful to sketch in a paper the region of the xy-plane determined by the limits of integration.

  1. Evaluate the inner integral: Inner Integral = [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

  2. Evaluate the outer integral: Outer Integral = [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]

[Note that the above task is simply one of integrating a function over a region - there is no reference to a volume here.]

generalfeedback.text:
You are asked to evaluate the following double integral over a non-rectangular region.

\(\displaystyle \displaystyle\int_{x=0}^{@aa@}\displaystyle\int_{y=x}^{@aa@}\left(x^2+y^2\right)\; \mathrm{d}y \, \mathrm{d}x\)

The sketch should look something like this:

[[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [-0.5, {#aa+1#}, {#aa+1#}, -0.5], keepaspectratio: true, axis: true, showCopyright: false, showNavigation: false, grid: false }); // Hide tick labels and ticks on x-axis but label it board.defaultAxes.x.setAttribute({ ticks: { drawLabels: false, // hide numbers majorHeight: 0, minorHeight: 0 }, name: 'x', withLabel: true, label: { position: 'rt', offset: [10, -10] } }); // Hide tick labels and ticks on y-axis but label it board.defaultAxes.y.setAttribute({ ticks: { drawLabels: false, majorHeight: 0, minorHeight: 0 }, name: 'y', withLabel: true, label: { position: 'rt', offset: [-15, 0] } }); // Label at x = aa (vertical line position) board.create('text', [{#aa#}, -0.05, 'x = {#aa#}'], { anchorX: 'left', anchorY: 'top', fixed: true, }); // Label at y = 1 (horizontal line position) board.create('text', [-0.05, {#aa#}, 'y = {#aa#}'], { anchorX: 'right', anchorY: 'bottom', fixed: true, }); // Label at x = y (diagonal line position) board.create('text', [{#aa+0.05#}, {#aa+0.05#}, 'x = y'], { anchorX: 'left', anchorY: 'bottom', fixed: true, }); // line at x=1 const p1 = [{#aa#}, -1]; const p2 = [{#aa#}, 6]; const verticalLine = board.create('segment', [p1, p2], { dash: 2, color: 'gray', fixed: true }); // points var p = board.create('point', [0,0], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: false}); var q = board.create('point', [0,{#aa#}], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: false}); var r = board.create('point', [{#aa#},{#aa#}], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: false}); var triangle = board.create('polygon', [p, q, r],{name:"Triangle",withLabel:false, color: 'grey'}); [[/jsxgraph]]

Where the shaded area is the area of integration.

(a) In the triangle, \(x\) varies between \(x = 0\) and \(x = {@aa@}\). For every value of \(x\), \(y\) varies between \(y = x\) and \(y = {@aa@}\).

The inner integral is given by

\[\begin{align} \text{Inner}\hspace{0.1cm} \text{Integral} = \int_{y=x}^{@aa@} \left(x^2 + y^2\right)d\, \mathrm{d}y &= \left[ x^2 y + \dfrac{y^3}{3} \right]_x^{@aa@} \\ &= x^2 \times {@aa@} + \dfrac{{@aa@}^3}{3} - (x^2 \times x + \dfrac{x^3}{3}) \\ &= {@aa*x^2@} + {@aa^3/3@} - \dfrac{4x^3}{3} \end{align}\]

(b) The inner integral is placed in the outer integral to give

\begin{align} \text{Outer}\hspace{0.1cm} \text{Integral} = \int_0^{@aa@} \left({@aa*x^2@} + \dfrac{{@aa^3@}}{3} - \dfrac{4x^3}{3}\right)\, \mathrm{d}x &= \left[ \dfrac{{@aa*x^3@}}{3} + \dfrac{{@aa^3@}x}{3} - \dfrac{x^4}{3}\right]_0^{@aa@} \\ &= (\dfrac{{@aa@} \times {@aa^3@}}{3} + \dfrac{{@aa^3@} \times {@aa@}}{3} - \dfrac{{@aa@}^4}{3}) - 0 \\ &= {@aa^4/3@} \end{align}
